radiographic_examinations.findings: No appreciable abnormalities of the knee; the patella was not yet ossified.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat radiographs demonstrated hypoplasia of the femoral condyles as well as a proximally positioned patella (patella alta).

radiographic_examinations.findings: The patella was positioned in the patellofemoral groove and the reconstructed patellar tendon was intact.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: At two years postoperatively, the reconstructed patellar tendon and the patella were in the physiologic position but the quadriceps muscle remained atrophic.

radiographic_examinations.findings: The patella is in a relatively normal position; the reconstructed patellar tendon is intact.
The patella was in a more proximal position than normal.
